div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This document describes the namespace &nsname; defined by the specification (&xq.spec.date.month; &xq.spec.date.year; version). This namespace is identified in this document by the namespace prefix qfa:, but that is not a predefined namespace prefix; this namespace is not defined by an XML Schema. For updated information, please refer to the latest version of the specification.
This document describes the intended uses of this namespace. The W3C reserves the right to define names in this namespace in the future. is the only specification that may amend this namespace.
This document contains a directory of links to related resources, using RDDL (as defined in ).
It is GRDDL-enabled (as defined in ), that is to say that a GRDDL-compliant processor can extract useful RDF (as defined in ) representations of the information contained herein.

rddl:resource.xlink:title: XQuery Annotations
rddl:resource.p: provides syntax to define annotations on function declarations and variable declarations. Two annotations are defined in . Application and query authors may define additional annotations, as may XQuery implementations. Those additional applications belong, by default, to the &nsname; namespace (but may be defined in other namespaces as well).

item.p: %public Public variables and public functions are accessible to module import. (Variables declared without either a %public or %private annotation are, by default, public variables.)
%private Private variables and private functions are hidden from module import.

div1.head: XQuery Features

rddl:resource.xlink:title: XQuery Features
rddl:resource.p: defines two features that are used to control the use of other, optional features.

item.p: qfa:require-feature identifies features that must be enabled for the module in which the option declaration occurs; if any of these QNames corresponds to a feature that the implementation does not support, a static error is raised.

qfa:prohibit-feature identifies features that must not be enabled in the module in which the option declaration occurs; if any of these QNames corresponds to a feature that the implementation supports, it must disable that feature.
